title: 115_s983
content: The Act is titled the "Helping to Encourage Real Opportunities (HERO) for At-Risk Youth Act" and it modifies and extends the Work Opportunity Credit for certain youth employees. Expansion of Credit for Summer Youth under the HERO Act includes allowing year-round employment for youth working up to 20 hours per week while attending secondary school between September 16 and April 30. The HERO Act expands the credit for summer youth by allowing year-round employment for students attending secondary school between September 16 and April 30. Amendments include increasing the credit amount and making conforming changes to the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The HERO Act expands the credit for at-risk youth by amending the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to include individuals certified as at-risk youth by a designated local agency. The HERO Act expands the credit for at-risk youth by including individuals certified as at-risk youth by a designated local agency, based on specific criteria such as age, education, employment status, and employability. The amendments made by this section apply to individuals who start working for the employer after the enactment of this Act. The section extends the empowerment zones until December 31, 2019, and allows for amendments to nominations for new termination dates.
